description: From Middle English commoeven, from Old French commovoir.

verbs.description: commove (third-person singular simple present commoves, present participle commoving, simple past and past participle commoved)

entries.meaning: (dated, transitive) To move violently; to agitate, excite or rouse
examples: Hereupon Mr. Worldly Wiseman was much commoved with passion, and shaking his cane with a very threatful countenance, broke forth upon this wise: "Learning, quotha!" said he; "I would have all such rogues scourged by the Hangman!"
